availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert Armstrong Athey (Kenton County, lawyer, asst. adjutant general for KY vols (U.S.A.))

body.p: Covington, Kentucky, attorney and soldier. Lexington, Kentucky, native. Married to Elizabeth J. Wallace Athey. Married to Mary Katherine Stephens Athey on January 17, 1865. Attended Transylvania University in Lexington, Kentucky. Graduate of Transylvania Law School in 1845. Member of the Presbyterian Church. Member of the Lexington City Council in 1849. City attorney in Lexington from 1849 to 1850. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from 1850 to 1851. Served in the Kentucky State Adjutant General's Department (U.S.A.) as a major and Assistant Adjutant General until August 31, 1863. County attorney for Kenton County, Kentucky, from 1864 to 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Ward 1, Covington, p. 26.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Kenton County Marriages, Film #001943299, p. 19.
The Biographical Encyclopædia of Kentucky of the Dead and Living Men of the Nineteenth Century, vol. 1 (Cincinnati: J. M. Armstrong & Company, 1878), 426.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), VII.
“Judge Robert Armstrong Athey (1825-1901)," Find A Grave, Memorial 89872523, accessed on May 17, 2017, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/89872523.
